channel.title: A Motivating Example on Measure Theory in Action
channel.description: Recent content in A Motivating Example on Measure Theory in Action

item.title: Vector-Valued
item.description: Vector-Valued Maps We can treat each measurement individually. We refer to the QoI map induced by this treatment as being vector-valued.

item.title: Scalar-Valued
item.description: Scalar-Valued Maps We can combine the information in some way into a single value. We refer to the QoI map induced by this treatment as being scalar-valued.

item.title: The Objective
item.description:
What we’re after We want to infer the values of \(\lambda_1\) and \(\lambda_2\) . We want to quantify the uncertainty in our parameters.
How do we use the information from our sensors to do this?
